name: licensing

kind.description: Identifies the resource as a LicenseAssignment.

skuName.description: Display Name of the sku of the product.

userId.description: The user's current primary email address. If the user's email address changes, use the new email address in your API requests. Since a userId is subject to change, do not use a userId value as a key for persistent data. This key could break if the current user's email address changes. If the userId is suspended, the license status changes.

skuId.description: A product SKU's unique identifier. For more information about available SKUs in this version of the API, see Products and SKUs.

productId.description: A product's unique identifier. For more information about products in this version of the API, see Product and SKU IDs.

nextPageToken.description: The token that you must submit in a subsequent request to retrieve additional license results matching your query parameters. The maxResults query string is related to the nextPageToken since maxResults determines how many entries are returned on each next page.

items.description: The LicenseAssignments in this page of results.

kind.description: Identifies the resource as a collection of LicenseAssignments.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/apps.lic.description: View and manage G Suite licenses for your domain

listForProduct.description: List all users assigned licenses for a specific product SKU.

customerId.description: Customer's customerId. A previous version of this API accepted the primary domain name as a value for this field. If the customer is suspended, the server returns an error.

pageToken.description: Token to fetch the next page of data. The maxResults query string is related to the pageToken since maxResults determines how many entries are returned on each page. This is an optional query string. If not specified, the server returns the first page.

maxResults.description: The maxResults query string determines how many entries are returned on each page of a large response. This is an optional parameter. The value must be a positive number.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

description: The Google Enterprise License Manager API's allows you to license apps for all the users of a domain managed by you.
